text: I'm so tired from my being sad over my uncle's death and general pandemic stress.
I miss my uncle so much, and I don't know how I'm going to move on without him as a part of my life.
I'm relieved that my uncle didn't die in worse circumstances.

I am heavily grieving my uncle's death, who was very close to me and whom I couldn't be with during the pandemic. I feel awful about not answering his phone call because I had to care for my family who got infected. His death has made me mentally unwell.
I'm so upset with my employer for making us continue to work in pandemic conditions even though it is so damaging to us.
My workplace seems to not ease up on protocols.
I feel left out because everyone I know gets to unmask except me.
I'm worried about what the pandemic is doing to my mental health.
I feel so lonely and isolated like I have no I can rely on.
At the very least, the pandemic isn't as bad as it used to be and it's somewhat relieving. In addition, I know that I have my therapist's support.

I've gotten way sadder during the pandemic and I have no one to speak to because I have no contact with my family or any friends. In addition, I feel that my therapist isn't helping me progress mentally.

My friend could be a risk to me because he has an unvaccinated friend. My brother and sister in law are afraid of unvaccinated people and are advising me to not see anybody who is unvaccinated because they have young children.
I find it hard to trust my doctor's advice when I keep hearing so much conflicting information.
I'm afraid that both getting COVID and getting the vaccine will be harmful because of my disease.
I'm wary of what health professionals have to say; if they don't even know how to deal with my Hashimoto's disease, I don't know if I want to hear what they have to say with COVID-19 and the vaccine.

I don't know if I want to get the vaccine because it might potentially cause something for me, an immunocompromised person. I'm conflicted and don't know what to do because I want to get the vaccine so that I don't get infected, but I also don't want to get it because it could do something to me.
I don't know if I can take a third wave, this pandemic has already taken everything from me, and I'm just tired of feeling helpless.
I hate that no one cares about all the lives we're about to lose.
I'm afraid that the pandemic will go on forever. My anxiety is so severe that I physically cannot work.

The pandemic has worsened my financial situation. In addition, my friends don't speak to me and the ones I do always tell me to find a therapist in spite of barely affording one. I'm considering starving to be able to pay for therapy.
I'm a little frustrated with people spreading fear and pessimism when it's not based on fact.
People are afraid of the idea of COVID-19 protocols lasting forever.
People should not freak out about the outbreak in Israel because it actually wasn't a large outbreak in comparison.
I don't think I will ever be free of COVID, I don't think I will ever be safe from COVID.
It's disheartening to hear that breakthrough infections are still resulting in long COVID and there's not much that can be done against it. I feel defeated from hearing about this.
I'm tired of other people dismissing my feelings with their optimism.
If Israel is reimposing mask mandates, I feel like we will be free of this pandemic.
I don't want people to attempt to cheer me up.
I'm afraid of the pandemic going on forever.
Because of my symptoms and what I've been seeing in the news I'm scared that the vaccine gave me heart problems, and I'm now scared of getting the 2nd shot.
I'm concerned about getting my 2nd dose of <ORG> because I don't want to have heart problems and end up in the hospital and paying for that hospital visit.
Despite being vaccinated, I'm still worried about catching COVID when I go outside.
I'm excited that things are opening up again especially the movie theater.
I would like to go back out but I still don't want to risk getting infected.
The pandemic situation in my area is getting better.
I'm worried about how this pandemic has affected my mental and physical health.
Since just as things were getting better, Delta is just making things worse, and I feel hopeless that I will ever get my normal life back.
I'm fearing the risk of going out because of this recent news. My health issues add to my anxiety of going out. I fear Delta and what it can do and I want to isolate because of it.
Because of this pandemic, I am not doing well mentally. I don't know how to proceed with my life.
I'm annoyed that finding information about COVID has been so difficult.
Because the virus is so new, its very difficult to find information about it.
I thought I was in good enough health to go back to working out.
I don't know if I should visit my family yet because they just got their second dose and are thus not fully protected.
I'm tired of restrictions being reinstated because it makes me feel like they will never truly be gone.
I'm upset because despite all the sacrifices and how far we've come it seems like we will never fully return to normal life.
I didn't want masks to come back.
We will never return to pre-pandemic lifestyles and pandemic protocols will be in place for eternity.
I feel defeated because all the progress that has been done was ruined by Delta.
I'm so upset that the stupidity of a few people is prolonging this pandemic for the rest of us, and I'm losing hope.
Anti-vaxxers are prolonging the pandemic for everybody. I hate that they refuse to take the vaccine and nothing can really be done about it.
I'm irrationally feeling that the pandemic will never end because of anti-vaxxers.
I'm worried about how this pandemic is affecting my mental health.
I feel stuck in this miserable existence and I don't know what to do about it at this point.
Online classes and working from home is not ideal for me.
I'm afraid of the pandemic never ending.
I'm not coping well in the pandemic and I feel hopeless.
I'm worried that my <ORG> vaccine won't be as effective against the Delta variant.
It's confusing to me that people don't want to vaccinate.
I would like to know how protected my family and I are against Delta.
The vaccine was supposed to fix everything and now that it hasn't I'm just tired of all the anxiety about COVID.
People are talking about another wave, and it's making me anxious about going back into work where I might catch COVID.
I'm happy to be fully vaccinated since I waited for this for so long.
Even though I got the vaccine, it doesn't seem to change much about my situation, and I'm still afraid of COVID, so I feel kind of disappointed.
I'm scared that the pandemic will take away my return to the office.
I'm happy to have gotten my second dose. In addition, I feel good about practicing safety and not invigorating the pandemic by getting vaccinated and staying home.

I feel like my vaccine was supposed to bring my life back to normalcy and I got disappointed when it didn't. I'm sad about having to stay home for the summer. I feel like my vaccine was pointless because we're still going to have to follow protocols.
Because Iceland has dropped restrictions I'm concerned about going out without being fully vaccinated.
I'm worried about my safety because I don't have my 2nd dose yet and Iceland opened up.
I'm so done with COVID, and I don't have the energy to continue with the pandemic precautions, especially since  I was just getting my normal life back.
Because of all the stories I've been hearing, I'm scared that I might get a breakthrough case.
I'm annoyed because despite being careful and taking necessary safety precautions, there are still breakthroughs even among vaccinated people. I want to continue living my life without any worries.
Though it is not as severe, I am apprehensive of the situation because there have been breakthrough cases even with fully vaccinated people.
I'm slightly worried that this blood drop isn't normal.
I'm happy that I got through my fears and got my vaccination.
Based on what the WHO said I'm scared that even despite vaccinations we will be stuck in this pandemic forever.

I'm very confused as to who to trust because the CDC and the WHO are saying conflicting things; in addition, the WHO saying we have to mask and social distance again is starting to make me afraid. News about Delta causing COVID-19 protocols to return is making me think they will never end.
I'm worried that by watching all the news on Delta, my view is skewed to be overly pessimistic, and I will lose sight of what I really should focus on which is vaccinations.
The WHO message, alongside other various reports on Delta, is causing me extreme anxiety about the pandemic.

The pandemic situation is objectively not as bad as I think it is right now. The pandemic is not going to be forever and we are continuing to vaccinate. We're doing a lot better compared to when the pandemic first started.
I'm terrified of living through the Delta wave because my country is so under prepared for COVID.
I don't have any hope that we're going to make it out of this pandemic ok, if we make it out at all.

The pandemic situation in South Africa is absolutely awful. Hospitals are at capacity and vaccine rollouts aren't doing well. In addition, I've been noticing that people aren't following COVID-19 protocols around me.
I was getting help for my mental health, and I feel like the progress for that was just thwarted by the Delta variant.

I'm scared that my parents are going to catch COVID especially my mother because she's high risk. <SEP> I'm worried that my parents are going to get sick, and then I will be left to deal with everything alone.
I'm worried about my unvaccinated parents. I don't want them to get Delta. In addition, my mother is high-risk and will likely get super harmed by COVID-19.
I have to undertake very difficult responsibilities if something happens to my parents.
I'm worried that because I've been taking painkillers to deal with the vaccine side effects they've hindered my vaccine efficacy.
I'm experiencing major side effects from my second dose.
I have been taking pain killers and now I am scared that I'm affecting the vaccine's immune response because of what I read.
I'm scared that I'm going to die from the vaccine, because two people already have.
My experiences and thoughts should not be conflated with anti-vax sentiments.
The two deaths from <ORG> is invigorating my anxiety and repels me from getting vaccinated.

I'm scared that we will have to go back into lockdown and what that will do to my mental health. <SEP> I'm scared that my workplace will insist on us working in person and that will put me at risk of COVID>
I feel doomed to a life of misery and I feel hopeless that things will get better.
I feel so drained from the pandemic that I don't have any energy left to go on with this.
I've lost all hope that things will ever get better.
I'm really scared of the idea of another lockdown happening.

The pandemic has been hard for me mentally and I'm starting to really lose it. I've felt so defeated in this pandemic that I haven't really had any hope. My life has gotten much worse since the pandemic.
I'm so frustrated with Delta and the pandemic for ruining my chance to have a normal high school experience.
Because of the Delta wave I'm worried that my school will go back to on-line classes.
Delta could end up taking away another year of high school from me.
I was not able to have a regular high school life because of the pandemic. I hate that Delta might ruin another year for me.
All these side effects make me feel so isolated and I've had to give up so many things in my life, school, my freinds, etc.
I do not want my views conflated with anti-vax sentiments.
I am experiencing better symptoms than those with Long COVID.

I'm in pain and extremely weak because of the vaccine, causing me to withdraw from school. These symptoms are taking a toll on me mentally. In addition, no one else is experiencing what I am, and instead returning to normal. It's really difficult having to take time to let my health recover.
I'm frustrated that other people don't understand why I'm still so anxious about COVID and try to pressure me into doing things.
I'm content with just getting some semblance of my normal life back again.

I hate having to always explain why I don't want to do certain things when the pandemic is still going on. People keep wanting to proceed as normal as if the pandemic ended. I don't want to continuously tell people that I don't feel comfortable with hanging out.
It's wonderful to be able to do things that I could do before the pandemic started.
It hurts to be told that my fears of going out is invalid even though its still so dangerous.
I'm tired of dealing with these masks, they just make my life miserable.

My experiences should not be conflated with anti-mask sentiments. Masks trigger my migraines as well as my sensory disability, which makes wearing it hard. I really do not want to wear it in my last year of school.
I'm worried about catching COVID in a crowded venue where the COVID policies are lax, especially because of Delta.
I'm taking a huge risk by going into this concert. My state is loose on enacting protocols. In addition, Delta has been making me worried about going out.
I'm upset that just because I took the first vaccination that was offered, which I thought was the right thing to do, my vaccination isn't accepted in some countries.
I don't understand why governments care about which vaccines are taken by visitors.
I should've taken a different vaccine. Some countries not accepting <ORG>-vaccinated individuals is making me feel discriminated.
I don't know how much I should trust the WHO's recommendation because I don't know who it's even addressed to and based on what others have been saying.

I'm scared that with everything reopening we're going to get another variant that the vaccine won't work against and everything will be just as bad as before. <SEP> I'm worried that if we have another lockdown my mental health won't survive it.
It's wonderful knowing that a lot of people in Canada are about to get their second dose.
I'm worried what the new mask mandate means for our pandemic recovery.
Reading news about COVID-19 causes me anxiety.
Being vaccinated means I'm protected, which is relieving to know.
I'm so frustrated with all the misinformation going around and it feels like every time I manage to explain something to my mom, she gets convinced by another lie.
This whole pandemic has made me feel so helpless and now I feel like I can't even help my own mother.
I keep trying to clear up misconceptions (about something regarding COVID-19) but there's continuously more information releasing that seems to disprove me.
I'm really upset for my mother who got lied to and now I'm really stressed for her.
Watching this made me happy so that's why I wanted to share it with other people.
I'm worried about bringing home COVID to my son.
Masking in the gym is inconvenient for me.
I'm scared of infecting my child.
I'm s happy to hear such a good piece of news about the vaccine.
The vaccines can ward off the virus for a long time.
I'm so tired of being so paranoid.
I'm scared that my daughter is going to catch COVID from the fresh produce.
Groceries could contain the virus and infect my child.
I feel kind of sad that we seem to be going backwards with COVID, especially since I just got used to living a normal life.
Wearing a mask inconveniences me.
The protocols being rolled back has helped my mental health improve.
I'm upset over seeing the protocols return so soon.
Because of Delta, I'm worried about my unvaccinated son getting COVID again.

I don't know what to do because I'm seeing conflicting information as to when my infected son should get the vaccine. In addition, Delta is a threat, so I would like for my son to get vaccinated as soon as possible.
I don't know how to proceed with my second dose because there is no <ORG> offered in America and I don't know what to do if I want to get a different vaccine brand.
I'm so frustrated with my government and country in general for being so stupid about CIVD and keeping the rest of us stuck in this pandemic.
I'm so tired of living through this pandemic with no hope that it will ever end.
I feel like the pandemic will continue for a long time in the Czech Republic because of other people's irresponsibilities.
After hearing all this news about Delta, I'm still scared of catching COVID despite being vaccinated.

I'm fearing for the safety of my children who are very young and can't get vaccinated. In addition, Delta's transmissibility worries me. I, as well as others, mask up to ward off the virus and create a safer environment for each other.
The constant bad news has slowly drained me.
I feel trapped in this pandemic and my depression.
I constantly feel terrible (presumably about the pandemic) and I feel like these moods won't stop.
I'm frustrated with my school and with COVID for not letting me take this class.
I'm upset that I was robbed of this experience that I wanted to have so badly.
My school is afraid of spreading the virus through these tools.
As a result of the pandemic disrupting my past two school years, I was not able to take a course that I wanted to.
I'm kind of frustrated with COVID and my school for preventing me from taking this course I was really interested in.
I was really looking forward to taking this class so I'm upset that I missed out on my only chance to take it because of COVID.
I'm disappointed that I couldn't experience this course because of the pandemic.
I'm worried that the new wave might be as bad as this winter was.
I'm happy that we finally seem to be recovering from the pandemic.
I wonder if these articles are just trying to fearmonger to keep readers engaged and I dislike this practice.
I was not doing well when the pandemic peaked in the winter and I'm not ready for another wave.
The pandemic situation in Germany is not that bad currently.
I'm so tired of being hopeful that the pandemic is ending only to be threatened with a new and more contagious variant.
I'm worried that Delta might bring back lockdowns and COVID regulations and what that would do to my mental health.
I'm happy to be vaccinated and enjoying a somewhat normal life.
I don't want another surge to happen because of Delta. I really don't want to return to things like online school and lockdowns.
It's nice to see my friends return to some sense of normalcy again. Seeing low COVID-19 cases was a relief for me.
Delta's arrival has crushed my optimism. I always end up sad from hearing about these new variants.
I'm somewhat worried that this new variant is going to put us back into lockdown.
I'm worried about the pandemic returning to a point where we have to follow strict COVID-19 protocols again.
The stress around COVID is just so overwhelming and I know that this is only the beginning.
My child is experiencing symptoms. In addition, my child was tempted into a building (where he potentially got COVID-19?). I'm so worried for my children's safety at school.
Children seem the most susceptible to exposure and risky situations and as much as I don't want my child to go through that, they prohably will. In addition,
I'm worried that because my government is so focused on case numbers and not hospitalizations/deaths that they'll misinterpret the data and put us back into lockdown.

I'm annoyed at our governor for being ready to put the country in lockdown at the slightest rise. Our chief medical officer keeps prioritizing case numbers when making decisions on the country's safety.
I'm worried that the lockdowns will happen again because my government is trigger-happy with enacting them.
Because of the Delta variant, I'm a little apprehensive about meeting unmasked people.
Someone I was in contact with (presumably, we are both fully vaccinated) was unmasked and although it is okay, the news about Delta is not letting my anxiety over a potential infection ease.
I'm still scared of getting the Delta variant.
I'm so frustrated with both the UK and Denmark for the way they're handling COVID precautions, and because of these policies I can't seem my family/friends.
I have so many friends and family at risk, and I'm so scared that I'm going to lose them.
I'm so lonely, and I'm missing my family/friends, but I don't even know when I will get to see them again, and I feel so disconnected from everyone celebrating lowered restrictions.
I've been worried about my family and my best friend because they are all high-risk and not in the best of health. I really don't want to lose someone that I haven't seen in a while.
I deeply miss my family members.
I'm worried that the spreading Delta variant and rising cases means we'll have to go back into lockdown again.
I'm comforted by the knowledge that cases in NJ are stable.
I'm relieved that New Jersey isn't getting a tremendous Delta surge like some other states (who have a lower vaccination rate) are.
I'm worried that I might have COVID since I went to a crowded place unvaccinated.
I don't know how to deal with my anxiety, and it makes everything in life so difficult, and I'm really concerned about my mental health since nothing seems to be working.
Not being around people because of lockdowns have taken an extreme toll on my mental health. My breakup has revigorated my anxiety.
Seeing my family again, getting my job back, and meeting with a therapist has done wonders for my mental health.
I'm scared that I might be experiencing side effects from the vaccine, and I don't know what to do.
I'm pretty sure my symptoms aren't normal and I am seeking information to confirm this.
I'm concerned about being caught in a limbo between two different countries who have different vaccination standards.
I'm a little upset both at being misinformed on my grandmother being vaccinated, but also because no one bothered to explain why to me.
I'm concerned about my grandmother being unvaccinated, visiting my unvaccinated grandmother, since I'm worried about the health risks for her and myself.
I'm scared about infecting my mother because she is unvaccinated and the variants seem to be more transmissible.
It's frustrating that there are almost no protocols for how to transition out of isolation.

I've been trying to slowly ease out of isolation, but I'm anxious about how my actions are perceived. <SEP> The lack of solid safety recommendations makes me feel unprepared to go out during the Delta wave.
I feel left behind by society, but I'm still not sure what I'm supposed to do.
I am bored and not enjoying what I'm doing when I'm outside.

I feel that I put myself at risk by attending this certain outdoor gathering. In addition, I don't want to be perceived, but everytime I go out, I feel shame afterwards. In addition, I'm anxious about Delta and don't exactly trust following the CDC recommendations.
I've been looking forward to doing things outside.
My life is still not completely normal even though everyone else's is.
I'm upset that my condition has put me in such a difficult position.
I'm afraid that the vaccine, because of my previous medical condition, is going to give me lasting heart problems.

As a hypochondriac, I'm really scared of the symptoms I've been experiencing. Seeing the article about the vaccine causing heart problems is making me think the vaccine did something to me. I'm very scared of the heart problems and now I'm also scared of the second dose making it worse.
Because of my family memeber's experience I'm starting to doubt how much the vaccine protects against COVID symptoms.
A family member that I am in close contact with is displaying symptoms that they had when they had COVID-19, and I am scared about getting exposed by them.
I'm anxious about my child attending this party, even though I know it's mostly safe I can't get rid of this anxiety.
It's comforting to know that COVID precautions are still being taken.
I do not want my child to get infected, so I'm a little scared for her being at this birthday party. Some people are unvaccinated, which worries me, so I am asking them to mask up as a precaution.
Knowing that every adult that will be near my child is vaccinated makes me happy because I won't have to worry for her safety as much.
I so tired of the never ending cycle of this pandemic, I feel hopeless that things will ever improve.
I'm worried about how Delta will affect vaccine efficacy and how this might affect restrictions on vaccinated individuals.
The fact that <ORG> is les effective against Delta frightens me and I worry about how people will process this information, as well as the pandemic continuing.
Since my mother started showing symptoms as well I'm concerned about how that will affect my quarantine.
I'm concerned about my mother catching COVID because she's at risk and because of the recent Delta wave.
I'm mad at the pandemic for ruining everything for me, including my relationship, and I'm upset at the 'experts' who advised us to go into lockdown.
I'm so upset that lockdown has ruined everything good in my life and I don't know what the point is living like this.
I'm experiencing extreme pandemic fatigue. In addition, I'm directing my anger at the experts because I think they are the cause of the pandemic protocols being in place.
I desperately want to be with somebody but the pandemic is preventing that. I'm experiencing suicidal thoughts because of the loneliness I'm feeling.
I'm worried about attending this wedding because I think there will be a pretty big risk of COVID. <SEP> I'm concerned about the efficacy of the <ORG> vaccine against Delta.

My health anxiety is invigorated by the pandemic and I do not want to take the risk of being infected from a large gathering. The risk is also much larger because the majority of my area is unvaccinated and unmasked.
I'm terrified of COVID and how it would affect me and my family. <SEP> I'm scared of being judged for my obsessive tendencies about the pandemic.
I feel disconnected from my family, who don't really understand (except for my brother) my anxiety around COVID.
A lack of will to get vaccinated for some Americans will continue to endanger others with a larger risk of spreading the virus. Because of this, I doubt that I will be able to travel at all.
I'm mad that the careless and ignorant actions of other Americans will reflect on me as an American and keep me from traveling freely.
I'm scared that we will go back to more extreme lockdown restrictions.
Being one of the only masked people nowadays makes me fear that the pandemic will extend.
These two songs trigger my anxiety from lockdown, and I have to wonder if I will ever be free of the trauma from lockdown.
I associate these two songs with a very bad period in my life that happened during the pandemic and as a result, it has become a trigger for me.
I'm concerned that there's a possibility that my headaches might be tied to my vaccine, but I'm also not too worried.

I'm scared of the Delta variant and the increased risk of a breakthrough case. <SEP> I don't want to have to wear a mask again, but I'm worried that because of the Delta variant my state might bring back the mask mandates.
I feel better knowing that our area has a higher vaccination rate so we are better protected against Delta.
Wearing a mask is difficult for me as it causes me breathing problems and I want to wear makeup, which is why a mask mandate is inconveniencing.
I'm worried about the vaccine not being able to protect me against Delta.
I'm happy that my area is heavily vaccinated.
I'm concerned about getting COVID at this party since it doesn't really follow COVID precautions and I'm so close to getting my second shot.
I'm upset with the government and how we have to deal with the consequences of their mismanagement of the pandemic.
I'm afraid that we're going to go back into lockdown and I'm terrified of what that's going to do to my mental health since I already feel like I'm barely hanging on.
My life feels so hopeless these days living in lockdown and I feel like I can't no longer trust anything good in my life.

I don't want to get into another lockdown because I don't want to go through the mental strain I went through the first time there was a lockdown. In addition, I don't know how our healthcare system will deal with the pandemic in the future if we can barely deal with it right now.
The pandemic has destroyed me mentally and has taken away so many opportunities from me.
I'm frustrated with our government and how they didn't do enough to protect us from COVID, and now we're living through the consequences of their poor decisions.
I worry that if things are bad now they will be much worse in Winter, and I'm afraid we'll have to go into another lockdown.

Every time things seem to get better they then get worse, and we get stuck in another lockdown, and being in lockdown makes me feel like I have no life or future to look forward to and I just feel hopeless.
I'm angry at my government's awful protocols managing to introduce Delta into the country.
I'm afraid of another lockdown happening because I could barely handle the last one. In addition, I'm worried about our hospital system handling the wave in the Winter.

I feel incredibly defeated right now. The pandemic has made me a sadder person. The situation in the UK has been going downhill. I feel bad about complaining about my situation because it isn't that bad compared to some others. The pandemic has taken away my ability to work.
I have to be cautious because of my mother's health and so I'm worried that my valved mask will not provide enough protection.
I'm trying to protect my high risk mother and I, so I am seeking out information about what will protect me heavily because I don't want to infect her.
I'm so mad at <PERSON> and our Government for their mismanagement of the pandemic that has led to the spread of the Delta virus which has on this pandemic well past my breaking point.
I'm disgusted at the way I am expected to make all these sacrifices for people who won't even take their own health seriously.
I'm scared that because of Delta and the worsening pandemic situation we may have to go back under lockdown restrictions, and I'm afraid of what that will do to my mental health.
I'll lose it if another lockdown happens.
I'm concerned about the possible side effects of the vaccine that I've been hearing about more and more, but I'm also afraid of catching the virus.
I have a moral objection to taking another vaccine brand.
I'm worried about getting my second dose as I do not want to risk any blood clots or risk death.
I'm scared of the possible allergic reactions/side effects of my second shot.

I was afraid of the impacts of the vaccine on me because I experience severe allergies. In addition, I'm experiencing a reaction after getting vaccinated. I'm scared of the risk of getting myocarditis.
The lockdowns and the self-isolation have made me afraid to have fun because I'm so worried that lockdown is going to return and take away everything I love.
I feel so hopeless and disconnected from those around me since I seem to be the only one still stuck in this anxiety.
A lot of the feelings I'm having currently are because I have anxiety.
I feel really good
The pandemic has taken a huge toll on me mentally and I find it very difficult to enjoy my life or feel happy.
I'm frustrated with my in-laws' refusal to get a vaccine since it puts pressure on us to maintain strict precautions to not get them sick.
I'm worried about my in-laws' health since they refuse to get the vaccine and are especially vulnerable to COVID.
I hate that my family has to cater and center our lives for unvaccinated people. The burden being on us to remain safe instead of them getting vaccinated is taking a toll on all of us.
Even though my in-law's are high risk, they are not going to get vaccinated and it makes me highly concerned about what will happen to them.
I'm glad my experiences were heard and validated.

I don't know what to do with my family's overzealous approach to remain safe all for the sake of my unvaccinated in-laws. I need to break it and start working in-person for my personal success, but I cannot because this is still a thing.
Lockdown and all these restrictions have felt so draining.
I'm worried we might end up in another lockdown, and I'm scared of what that will do to my mental health.
After being in lockdown for so long, I find it hard to connect with people again, but I don't know what to do or where to go to make this better.
I'm concerned about going to get a tattoo from my cousin since I will be in close proximity to her for a long time, and she hasn't been taking necessary COVID precautions.
I'm seeing my unvaccinated cousin for a tattoo appointment and I'm afraid of the risk of seeing them.
My main motivation to get the shot was to meet someone, and now that I no longer believe in that I don't feel like the shot is worth the risk anymore.
I'm anxious about doing something that will mess up my first shot.
I'm overthinking and creating possibilities of what could go wrong when I get the vaccine, which is causing me anxiety.
I feel like I won't see the person I wanted to see, and I'm sad about it.
Anti-maskers don't wear masks for entirely different reasons than mine. I do not want my experience conflated with them.
I experience extreme discomfort with things around my mouth, which is why wearing a mask is so difficult for me.
I'm frustrated with people who refuse to wear a mask just because they don't want to.
I do not want to lose my pre-pandemic life yet again when I've experienced so much bliss just getting it back. Quarantine will literally ruin my life.
I'm re-experiencing my pre-pandemic life and I am thrilled about it. It has helped me so much mentally.
I'm so tired of lockdown, and I'm frustrated by knowing that if things get worse I will have to go back into lockdown.
I'm concerned about how Delta will affect our return to normal life, if we can return fully, and I'm concerned about how the vaccine will work against Delta.
I'm so happy I can go back to living normally, and I just feel so much better mentally.
I'm a little frustrated with my state because the lower vaccination rates probably means we will have to go back to more restrictions.
I'm scared that the pandemic situation is getting worse with Delta, and that we'll go back to isolation and I won't get the chance to see my friends.
I'm worrying about the pandemic getting worse and losing the opportunity to see my friends.
I'm excited to see my friends for the first time in a while since quarantine started.
I'm concerned about how the Delta variant will affect the U.S.'s pandemic recovery.
